definition: to seek a marriage partner/looking for a mate
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
elephant/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/shape/form/appearance/to imitate

sentences.english: I think that's probably true in getting jobs and seeking, um, you know, relationships.
sentences.chinese: 我想在找工作或者找对象方面确实如此。

sentences.english: Son, after graduating from university, work is not available, look for even more talk about the object.
sentences.chinese: 儿子大学毕业后，工作没有着落，找对象更是奢谈。

sentences.english: When choosing a partner I make two mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 在找对象的时候，我犯了两个错误。

sentences.english: Make certain to let all your friends know that you are looking to meet someone.
sentences.chinese: 一定要让你的朋友知道你在找对象。

sentences.english: Guangzhou Daily: What Is the Difficulties in "3H" Female White-collars' Marriages?
sentences.chinese: “三高”女白领找对象难在何处？

sentences.english: Mating is as hard as the cleaving of the waters of the Red Sea.
sentences.chinese: 找对象之难，有如将红海之水劈开一般。

sentences.english: Maybe the problem is from the standard of her need.
sentences.chinese: 也说不定是她找对象的标准出了点问题。

sentences.english: A wooer should opens his ears more than his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 找对象要多用耳，少用眼。

definition: blind date/arranged interview to evaluate a proposed marriage partner (Taiwan pr. [xiang4 qin1])/to be deeply attached to each other
to be dating sb
to choose a spouse
to look for a partner
to seek new friends through personal ads, dating apps etc
young people in their late 20s or older who are still unmarried
to court/to go steady/to be dating
of marriageable age/nubile
"leftover woman" (successful career woman who has remained single)
to find oneself a partner
sham marriage, esp. a marriage between a gay man and a lesbian arranged in response to parental expectations of a conventional marriage/abbr. for 形式婚姻
unmarried/single
older (than average in a group, at school, for marriage etc)
to get married (of woman)
to get married and have kids/to start a family
no longer a child (idiom)
